snippet: LEAD: Thanks to the Federal Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986, some 700,000 migrant workers in California's $16.6 billion agricultural industry have applied for legal residency in the United States. But the stamp of impending legitimacy h...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: Thanks to the Federal Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986, some 700,000 migrant workers in California's $16.6 billion agricultural industry have applied for legal residency in the United States. But the stamp of impending legitimacy has yielded a mixed harvest for workers.

headline.main: FOR MIGRANT WORKERS, LEGALITY LOWERS WAGES

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: IMMIGRATION REFORM AND CONTROL ACT OF 1986

byline.original: By KATHLEEN SHARP; Kathleen Sharp is a business writer based in Santa Barbara, Calif
